intro: Coppensia hookeri f. albescens, commonly known as the white-flowered form of the mountain orchid, is a rare and striking plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its unique, showy white flowers that contrast with its green foliage. The plant typically grows in cool, shaded environments, often in rocky or forested habitats. Its flowers are borne on slender stems and are known for their delicate, fragrant appearance. This horticultural form is prized for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in specialized gardens.
